data.title: `Error: Cannot find module` when running Atom specs
data.body:
When I run `application:run-all-specs` I get an error `Error: Cannot find module '../lib/docblockr-view'`. Here's the full stacktrace:

```
Error: Cannot find module '../lib/docblockr-view'
  at Function.Module._resolveFilename (module.js:337:15)
  at Function.Module._load (module.js:279:25)
  at Module.require (module.js:363:17)
  at require (module.js:379:17)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/dmnd/.atom/packages/docblockr/spec/docblockr-view-spec.coffee:1:17)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/dmnd/.atom/packages/docblockr/spec/docblockr-view-spec.coffee:1:1)
  at Module._compile (module.js:455:26)
  at Object.requireCoffeeScript [as .coffee] (/Users/dmnd/github/atom/src/coffee-cache.coffee:39:10)
  at Module.load (/Users/dmnd/github/atom/node_modules/coffee-script/lib/coffee-script/register.js:45:36)
  at Function.Module._load (module.js:311:12)
  at Module.require (module.js:363:17)
  at require (module.js:379:17)
  at requireSpecs (/Users/dmnd/github/atom/spec/spec-suite.coffee:8:5)
  at runAllSpecs (/Users/dmnd/github/atom/spec/spec-suite.coffee:48:3)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/dmnd/github/atom/spec/spec-suite.coffee:55:3)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/dmnd/github/atom/spec/spec-suite.coffee:1:1)
  at Module._compile (module.js:455:26)
  at Object.requireCoffeeScript [as .coffee] (/Users/dmnd/github/atom/src/coffee-cache.coffee:39:10)
  at Module.load (/Users/dmnd/github/atom/node_modules/coffee-script/lib/coffee-script/register.js:45:36)
  at Function.Module._load (module.js:311:12)
  at Module.require (module.js:363:17)
  at require (module.js:379:17)
  at module.exports.runSpecSuite (/Users/dmnd/github/atom/spec/jasmine-helper.coffee:31:3)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/dmnd/github/atom/spec/spec-bootstrap.coffee:24:3)
  at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/dmnd/github/atom/spec/spec-bootstrap.coffee:2:1)
  at Module._compile (module.js:455:26)
  at Object.requireCoffeeScript [as .coffee] (/Users/dmnd/github/atom/src/coffee-cache.coffee:39:10)
  at Module.load (/Users/dmnd/github/atom/node_modules/coffee-script/lib/coffee-script/register.js:45:36)
  at Function.Module._load (module.js:311:12)
  at Module.require (module.js:363:17)
  at require (module.js:379:17)
  at window.onload (file:///Users/dmnd/github/atom/static/index.js:20:25)
```

I tried disabling docblockr but I still get the same error. I also tried starting Atom via `atom --safe` and `atom --dev` but get the same error when I run specs. I also tried uninstalling the docblockr package, but I get the same error pointing at a different package ('../lib/highlight-selected-view' for example).

If I run `apm test` from my `~/github/atom` directory then things seem to work - all tests pass (except the one about being a release version):

```
$ apm test
2014-08-10 13:17:47.503 Atom[81162:507] Could not get code signature for running application, application updates are disabled: Error Domain=NSOSStatusErrorDomain Code=-67062 "The operation couldn’t be completed. (OSStatus error -67062.)"
[81164:0810/131747:INFO:renderer_main.cc(227)] Renderer process started
..[81162:0810/131748:INFO:CONSOLE(122)] "Failed to load package named 'package-with-broken-keymap'", source: /Users/dmnd/github/atom/src/package.coffee (122)
.....................................F...........................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................-......................................................................................................................................[81162:0810/131832:INFO:CONSOLE(1252)] "0", source: /Users/dmnd/github/atom/src/display-buffer.coffee (1252)
[81162:0810/131832:INFO:CONSOLE(1252)] "1", source: /Users/dmnd/github/atom/src/display-buffer.coffee (1252)
...................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................[81162:0810/131848:INFO:CONSOLE(0)] "event.returnValue is deprecated. Please use the standard event.preventDefault() instead.", source:  (0)
...............................................

the `atom` global
  .isReleasedVersion()
    it returns false if the version is a SHA and true otherwise
      Error: Leaking subscriptions for paths: /Users/dmnd/.atom/styles.less
        at ensureNoPathSubscriptions (/Users/dmnd/github/atom/spec/spec-helper.coffee:147:15)
        at [object Object].<anonymous> (/Users/dmnd/github/atom/spec/spec-helper.coffee:138:3)


Finished in 64.005 seconds
1227 tests, 4184 assertions, 1 failure, 1 skipped

Tests failed
```

It looks like some other people are encountering this too:
- Atom forum: [“Application: Run All Specs” fail to run](https://discuss.atom.io/t/application-run-all-specs-fail-to-run/7541)
- Stack Overflow: [Run package specs in Atom Editor always causes error](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/22985958/run-package-specs-in-atom-editor-always-causes-error)

data.title: Keybinding to Rename The Current Buffer
data.body: When saving a new file above the root folder of the current project, there is no way of reaching it via the tree view. It would be nice to be able to rename the current buffer by using <kbd>F2</kbd> or whatever maps to `tree-view:move`. As a workaround, one can open another Atom in the containing directory and rename/move the file from there using the tree view.

data.title: Quiting Atom causes closing projects in sidebar
data.body: When I quit and reopen Atom I lose all opened projects listed in sidebar and I got to drag all of those folders to Atom again.

data.title: Drag And Drop Selection
data.body: I just missed being able to drag and drop my selection. When one attempts to drag a selection, Atom just makes a new selection, beginning at the point of the drag and ending at the point of the drop. It should be possible to drag and drop the selection around in the current buffer and between buffers. For the latter, hovering above a buffer's tab should change the active buffer to there. This would make reorganizing content more intuitive by giving the user visual aid of what is being moved and where to.

data.title: Spawned processes with BufferedProcess don't get killed
data.body:
Running Atom 120. 
Windows 8.1 (64bit).
Node.js v0.10.30

I am using the grunt-runner plugin to run grunt within atom. With my own fix to actually let the plugin work (issue https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3200 fix: https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/3208), I can see in the task manager that a separate node process is being started for the grunt task I am executing. However, stoppping the grunt task, which on this line of code https://github.com/nickclaw/atom-grunt-runner/blob/master/lib/grunt-runner-view.coffee#L71 happens, doesn't kill the node process (that call to kill() is simply the kill call in BufferedProcess, so it's not a plugin issue).

![gif](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/37237580/Various-Pictures/not_killed_node_process.gif)

data.title: Fixes additional quotes on win32 in BufferedProcess
data.body:
Fixes issue https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3200 by putting quotes on the 'command' var only if it contains white space. This allows command paths with white space to still be executed but at the same time allows also commands like 'grunt' to work by not putting unnecessary quotes around the command.

Signed-off-by: Luca Moser moser.luca@gmail.com

data.title: BufferedNodeProcess does not work properly on Windows
data.body:
System: Windows 8.1
The BufferedNodeProcess does create a new atom.exe process, not a node process.
File: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/buffered-node-process.coffee

```
 node =
      if process.platform is 'darwin'
        # Use a helper to prevent an icon from appearing on the Dock
        path.resolve(process.resourcesPath, '..', 'Frameworks',
                     'Atom Helper.app', 'Contents', 'MacOS', 'Atom Helper')
      else
        process.execPath     # <- makes an atom.exe process
```

My workaround:

```
 node =
      if process.platform is 'darwin'
        # Use a helper to prevent an icon from appearing on the Dock
        path.resolve(process.resourcesPath, '..', 'Frameworks',
                     'Atom Helper.app', 'Contents', 'MacOS', 'Atom Helper')
      else
        'node'     # <- a node process, yay!
```

This is also why none of the Linters worked for me. You guys might have a better fix than that, but this simple change immediately made Linter work on my Windows machine.

data.title: Handle invisibles at the token level to fix char width measurement
data.body:
- [x] Get cursor position working correctly
- [x] Fix specs
- [x] Fix leading/trailing whitespace styling
- [x] Handle end of line invisibles in the model as well for consistency
- [x] Fix `editor:move-to-first-character-of-line`
- [x] Disable invisibles in mini editors

Fixes #3188
Fixes #2785

data.title: feature request: Open... dialogue should contain option to see hidden directories on *nix OS'.
data.body:
On Unix/Linux systems (Mac OS X, BSD/Dawin, Ubuntu, Debian, Red Hat, Suse, CentOS, etc.), when using the **Open...** dialogue from either the **File** menu or **cmd.-key-O**, one should be able to have a checkbox option in the dialogue to see hidden files (files with a "." in front of them, or *Nix system directories). This would make it much easier to open and edit system environment variables from within Atom. Please add this feature.

best,

—  faddah wolf
     portland, oregon, u.s.a.
     github.com/faddah

data.title: Enable native Services menu on OS X
data.body: Looks like Atom disables the native Services menu on OS X. Any chance of enabling it? I have loads of useful services that I don't want to have to reimplement/replace as packages.

data.title: Undo seemingly randomly refreshes to opened (not saved) state
data.body:
This has lost so much work in the las few days. I can't find a pattern: it happens in different file types and there doesn't appear to be any trigger, other than Undo.

I hit (Cmd-Z, with the keyboard), and occasionally and randomly it takes the file back to some previous state, but it's clearly NOT the last saved state. I believe it's the originally opened state.

If I'm not watching close, it'll happen and I miss it, then continue editing.

It leaves the file marked as "dirty", so saving after this happens will overwrite any changes since the state it restored it to, which in one case was a few days ago, so saving often does not help.

Version 0.120.0 on OS X Mavericks.

data.title: BufferedProcess adds too many quotes for command arguments
data.body:
Took me a while to actually understand what's wrong with @nickclaw's grunt-runner. The BufferedProcess is constructing the command like this:

(this is inside a modified Atom editor to see how the arguments are constructed)
![insane](http://puu.sh/aIXJa/438e34e0ac.png)

As you can see, it puts double quotes on the arguments and therefore the command/process will fail on Windows to execute.

If you would execute that command constructed like BufferedProcess does, you get an exception:
![nabanab](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/78361533f9f340bd5436f2efa56e0bb1dd2decad/687474703a2f2f7075752e73682f6149577a302f613331653866346361372e706e67)

Running the command with right put quotes of course works:
![bsdf](http://puu.sh/aIXTz/c175323420.png)

Changing:

```
   cmdArgs.unshift("\"" + command + "\"");
   cmdArgs = ['/s', '/c', "\"" + (cmdArgs.join(' ')) + "\""];
```

To:

```
  cmdArgs.unshift("\"" + command + "");
  cmdArgs = ['/s', '/c', "" + (cmdArgs.join(' ')) + "\""];
```

Would fix the issue.
Lines: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/buffered-process.coffee#L58

https://github.com/nickclaw/atom-grunt-runner/issues/18

data.title: Find with Regular Expressions
data.body: Is there any way an option to search with regular expressions in the "find in current buffer" field can be implemented? Maybe a toggle that differentiates between a regular expression search and a normal search?

data.title: Deleting a file locks up Atom (Windows 7)
data.body:
I'm getting a weird locking issue when deleting a file, or sometimes folder, in windows. This only happens if I've opened the file. Files I haven't touched delete just fine.

**Process:**
- Open Atom
- Click on file in side pane to open
- Click "x" to close file
- Right click file
- Select "Delete"
- Select "Move to Trash"
- Get "Editor is not responding" error

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2391/3830021/1df7410c-1d86-11e4-894d-cfaf838aca9d.PNG)

More details, these are .js and .coffee files from a node app I'm working on. So these files have also been running as a server or process at some point. 

**Versions:**
Atom 0.120.0. Windows 7 SP1.

data.title: buffers not recognizing branch change
data.body:
I'm using git, and seeing a recurring issue when merging where Atom will update the buffers after the first branch change, but then not after the merge and switch back to my working branch. This has caused accidental reversions of code, and I generally have to remember to close Atom, do my merging, and open it back up when I'm done.

I'm using 0.116.0 on Ubuntu 14.04.

data.title: Upgrade to atom-shell@0.15.4
data.body:
In atom-shell I have added a new `auto-hide-menu-bar` option for `BrowserWindow`, which hides the menu bar on Windows and Linux unless <kbd>Alt</kbd> is pressed.

I activated this option in this PR, but I'm not sure whether it should be default. /cc @kevinsawicki @nathansobo

data.title: Multi-key Binding with same Prefix does not work
data.body:
Hi guys,

I'm trying to add some key bindings for tab navigation in vim command mode. This is my `keymap.cson`:

```
'.editor.vim-mode:not(.insert-mode)':
  ', h': 'pane:show-previous-item'

'.editor.vim-mode:not(.insert-mode)':
  ', l': 'pane:show-next-item'
```

Pressing `,` while Key Binding Resolver is open shows only the later `, l` key binding. `, h` does not work. But `g t` and `g Shift-T` bindings from vim-mode are fine.

What also does not work correctly for me is something like:

```
 '.editor.vim-mode.insert-mode':
   'i i': 'vim-mode:activate-command-mode'
```

The keybinding itself works, but pressing a single `i` does not add it in text.

I'm on Windows 7 32-Bit. Atom 0.120.

Greetings,
Ed

data.title: Title bar displayed with multiple fullscreen windows (OS X)
data.body:
1. Open an Atom window with a file or project. (For some reason, this bug didn't happen when I tried to reproduce from an empty Atom window.)
2. Enter fullscreen mode (Ctrl-Cmd-F)
3. Open another window of Atom. (e.g. with the command line, File > Open [and then select a folder], or with the Project Quick Open package)

The window that opens will have a vestigial title bar at the top that looks like this:
![screen shot 2014-08-06 at 4 08 32 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1977010/3835399/bbbdf11e-1dbe-11e4-8bf4-d9a0d2049336.png)

It's not a big deal, but it does undermine the purpose of fullscreen mode a little bit. ;)

This is on Atom 0.120.0 running on OS X 10.9.3. I was able to reproduce the problem in safe mode.

data.title: Linux: Unable to launch after build (EACCESS exception)
data.body:
Ok so this was my first build on Linux.
After making sure the right node version was installed, I was able to complete the build seemingly without errors, following the [instructions](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/linux.md). 

However, when launching Atom, I get a permissions error of some kind during onload:
![screenshot from 2014-08-06 22 37 03](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7287076/3834475/dc2be864-1db1-11e4-9662-9bae6e9837fd.png)

I suspect I need to manually change folder permissions somewhere, but it's not clear to me where.

Any help would be much appreciated.

data.title: Invisibles, Font Size & Cursor
data.body:
Since I received 0.120 update editor went completely nuts, I tried downgrading to 0.116 and removed ~/.atom but it seems that that's not solving the problem and I can't recall which version I used before the update.

Here is my changes to config.cson:

```
'editor':
  'showInvisibles': true
  'invisibles':
    'cr': ''
    'eol': ''
    'space': ' '
    'tab': '⇥'
  'softTabs': false
  'fontSize': 15
```

![screenshot 2014-08-05 19 24 57](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1477518/3814703/a686356a-1cbd-11e4-81cd-b8c005772998.png)

Note that cursor is actually at the end of the line, if I would try to delete (backspace) letter "t" would be removed. Cursor placement changes depending on the font size. Im using standard theme and its probably the only change I made to the editor settings.

Mac OSX 10.9.4, Atom 0.116/0.120

data.title: Load the default themes in safe mode
data.body: Closes #3173.
